backend/main.mo: Motoko backend storing per‑user scenario templates and current scenarios with authorization checks and CRUD operations.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence listing implemented enhancements, affected files, components, and related test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file providing short summaries of all major frontend source files for reference.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS base styles and theme variables for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component handling auth, scenario state, autosave, and layout including builder and results.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthControl: Login/logout UI using Internet Identity with principal display and state handling.
frontend/src/components/results/Breakdow: Component rendering a scrollable table of detailed attack‑defense breakdown rows.
frontend/src/components/results/ChanceTo: UI card that selects a defender and displays the calculated probability of killing at least one model.
frontend/src/components/results/DamageCh: Renders a bar chart showing expected damage per defender based on deterministic results.
frontend/src/components/results/ExportBu: Provides a dropdown button to export combat results as JSON or CSV.
frontend/src/components/results/Histogra: Displays a histogram of simulated damage frequencies using bar widths scaled to counts.
frontend/src/components/results/ResultsD: Main results container handling deterministic and simulation views, simulation execution, and layout of all result cards.
frontend/src/components/results/Simulati: Inputs and controls for running Monte Carlo simulations, including iteration count and a run button.
frontend/src/components/results/SummaryC: Shows total expected damage, total kills, and kill breakdown per defender.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Attacke: Editor for attacker units allowing name, model count, and weapon management.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Defende: Editor for defender stats including model count, toughness, saves, wounds, and removal.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Presets: Empty file placeholder for scenario presets panel.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Priorit: Selector card for choosing target priority mode with descriptive text.
frontend/src/components/scenario/SavedTe: UI panel for saving, loading, and deleting scenario templates with authentication checks and template list management.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Scenari: Main scenario construction UI allowing creation and editing of attackers, defenders, weapons, priorities, and template operations.
frontend/src/components/scenario/WeaponE: Editor UI for configuring a weapon’s stats and special rules, with update and removal callbacks.
frontend/src/engine/chanceToKill.ts: Computes approximate kill probability using expected damage and a normal distribution approximation.
frontend/src/engine/deterministicExpecte: Calculates deterministic expected damage, hits, and wounds using probabilities, special rules, and dice averages.
frontend/src/engine/dice.ts: Parses dice notation, computes average values, and provides random dice rolling utilities.
frontend/src/engine/priority.ts: Sorts defender models based on selected target priority modes.
frontend/src/engine/probability.ts: Provides probability helpers for hit, wound, and save calculations including reroll logic.
frontend/src/engine/random.ts: Utility functions for rolling D6 and D3 values randomly.
frontend/src/engine/resolveScenario.ts: Computes deterministic expected damage for a combat scenario, tracking per-attacker/defender damage and expected kills.
frontend/src/engine/simulation.ts: Runs Monte Carlo simulations of combat, resolving hits, wounds, saves, damage, and FNP to produce aggregate damage statistics.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, refreshing dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useCurrentScenarioPer: Provides hooks to load and save the user's current scenario via the backend actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useDebouncedValue.ts: Returns a debounced version of a value after a specified delay.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an authentication context managing Internet Identity login, stored identities, and status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useSavedTemplates.ts: Exposes hooks to fetch, save, and delete user scenario templates through the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and a custom color palette for light and dark themes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with query client and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/models/combat.ts: Defines TypeScript models for weapons, units, scenarios, combat results, and simulation outputs.
frontend/src/presets/builtInPresets.ts: Empty preset file reserved for built‑in scenario templates.
frontend/src/state/useScenarioState.ts: React hook managing CombatScenario state with add/remove/update functions for attackers, defenders, weapons, and priority.
frontend/src/state/validation.ts: Provides numeric and dice-notation validation helpers for scenario input fields.
frontend/src/utils/exportResults.ts: Exports scenario results to downloadable JSON or CSV using browser Blob APIs.
frontend/src/utils/scenarioPersistence.t: Serializes and deserializes CombatScenario objects to backend-friendly string formats.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading URL parameters, persisting them in sessionStorage, and managing hash-based routing params.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, colors, animations, and plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata outlining architecture, features, models, and planned development direction.
